Detailed Description

C interface definitions for querying the USGS central CA velocity model (USER INTERFACE).

These are the routines that are used to query the USGS central CA velocity model from C. See f77vmquery.h for the routines to query the velocity model using Fortran via Fortran 77. If you are using C++, you should use the VMQuery object directly.

The current defaults for queries are:

  • return all values in a query,
  • query at the maximum resolution of the model
  • 128 MB cache for queries

The default behavior can be modified by calling the appropriate class method, e.g., cencalvm_queryType(), cencalvm_cacheSize(), cencalvm_queryVals().

The general order of use is:

  1. Create query object using cencalvm_createQuery()
  2. Set filename of database using cencalvm_filename()
  3. Optionally, set cache size using cencalvm_cacheSize()
  4. Optionally, set values to returnin query using cencalvm_queryVals()
  5. Open database using cencalvm_open()
  6. Query database using cencalvm_query()
  7. Close database using cencalvm_close()
  8. Destroy query object using cencalvm_destroyQuery()

The values associated with the error status come from the status of the error handler. See cencalvm::storage::ErrorHandler for what the values mean.

int cencalvm_query ( void *  handle,
double **  ppVals,
const int  numVals,
const double  lon,
const double  lat,
const double  elev 
)

Query the database.

Warning:
Array for values to be returned must be allocated BEFORE query.
Note:
Longitude and latitude are given in degrees in the WGS84 datum.
Elevation is given in meters with respect to mean sea level.
Values will be returned either of the order they are shown in cencalvm::storage::PayloadStruct or as specified with a call to queryVals().
Parameters:
handlePointer to query
ppValsPointer to array holding computed values (output from query)
numValsNumber of values expected (size of array (preallocated))
lonLongitude of location for query in degrees
latLatitude of location for query in degrees
elevElevation of location wrt MSL in meters
Returns:
Status of error handler
int cencalvm_queryRes ( void *  handle,
const double  res 
)

Set query resolution.

Meaning depends on type of query:

  • MAXRES Resolution is not applicable
  • FIXEDRES Query etree at level corresponding to resolution
  • AVGRES Resolution corresponds to minimum period of waves; etree is queried at lavel corresponding to minimum wavelength for shear waves
Parameters:
handlePointer to query
resResolution of query.
Returns:
Status of error handler
int cencalvm_queryType ( void *  handle,
const int  queryType 
)

Set query type.

Queries other than maximum resolution require an etree database that has been spatially averaged. This fills in parent octants with the average of its children.

Parameters:
handlePointer to query
queryTypeType of query

  • =0 Query at maximum resolution
  • =1 Query at fixed resolution
  • =2 Query at resolution tuned to wavelength of shear waves
Returns:
Status of error handler
int cencalvm_queryVals ( void *  handle,
const char *  names[],
const int  numVals 
)

Set values to be returned by queries.

Default is to return all values in order they appear in PayloadStruct plus the elevation of topography/bathymetry (ground surface or ocean floor; the query value is 'elevation').

Parameters:
handlePointer to query
namesNames of values to be returned in queries
numValsNumber of values to be returned in queries
Returns:
Status of error handler
int cencalvm_squash ( void *  handle,
const int  flag,
const double  limit 
)

Set squashed topography/bathymetry flag and minimum elevation of squashing.

Squashing is turned off by default.

Parameters:
handlePointer to query
flagTrue if squashing, false otherwise.
limitMinimum elevation for squashing.
